page.title: 09Manor Farm, Cottesmore
page.content: At Manor Farm Mr.Hollis has 500 breeding sheep and 800 lambs.He has one sheep dog called Bob who is eight years old and he leads the sheep to where Mr.Hollis wants them.There are nine tractors on the farm and one of the wheels was bigger than me. Mr. Hollis showed us a sheep that had magots in its wool,then he let us watch the sheep being dipped.He must dip them between 29 May and 2 July and the sheep do not like it,the water was green.Four or five sheep can be dipped at once, but they must be in for a minute. Mr. Hollis grows barley,rape,oats, wheat,hay and grass for silage.He mixes grass and molasses to make silage to give the sheep in winter. He also keeps 60 beef cattle and a few horses.The Manor Farm house is over 200 years old.
